snippet: Both men jumped from the building’s third floor to escape the fire. One landed on a box spring that appeared to be a mattress and later died; the other fell safely on a nearby awning.
abstract: Haitian immigrant Tony Celestin dies after leaping from window of Flatbush, Brooklyn, apartment building to escape fire; Celestin suffers severe burns and broken bones in incident; Celestin's roommate Jean Bertho Maurice survives after landing on store awning.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and REBECCA WHITE

lead_paragraph: Both men jumped from the building’s third floor to escape the fire. One landed on a box spring that appeared to be a mattress and later died; the other fell safely on a nearby awning.

headline.main: Brooklyn Apartment Fire Leaves One Man Dead and Another Injured
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Apartment Fire Leaves a Man, 64, Dead
